About

Seasoned, curious, hacker-scientist-type marketing technologist.

  • Winner of the 2014 Optimizely Optie Award in the category for “Best Advanced Feature Use”, finalist for “Most Interesting Integration,” together with my co-worker Rachel Johnson.
  • Experienced in A/B testing and experimental design for conversion rate optimization and online direct response marketing, doubling target revenue goal.
  • Strong affinity for communicating visually and in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
  • Fluent in Optimizely A/B testing, Qualaroo, and ClickTale, as well as with Python, Stata, SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, jQuery/JavaScript.

Looking to practice my craft in a Web optimization and testing-oriented role, where I am surrounded by incredibly curious, smart, and impactful coworkers.

I have a BA in Economics from Virginia Tech, an MS in Information Systems from Cal State Sacramento, and I did 3.5 years of a PhD program in Information Systems (not completed) at the University of Utah.

I grew up in Asker, Norway, and am a big fan of Hokies football. I’m also an amateur bike racer.
